144. UTF-8 encoding in PHP

According to the Podcast PHP Roundtable the best encoding to MySQL is utf8mb4 as this supports all the UTF-8 characters.

  • Remember to use in HTML head.
  • In a form you can use
    .
  • In HTTP use Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8.
  • Always use and a Content-Type header. Link: https://www.phproundtable.com/episode/character-encoding-and-utf-8-in-php Very good episode.

ALTER TABLE db_name.table_name DROP COLUMN status;
3:
142. Laravel Drop Unique Index

I was trying to drop an unique index via php artisan migrate but got an error which said I could not drop the column i was trying to remove the unique key from. This is the failing code:

public function up()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->dropUnique('title');
        });
}
public function down()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->unique('title');
        });
}

` The problem was I that dropUnique needs a full path/name for the index. Working example:

public function up()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->dropUnique('news_title_unique');
        });
}
public function down()
{
    Schema::table('news', function (Blueprint $table) {
            $table->unique('title');
        });
}

So dropUnique get first the table "news" then the column "title" and then the unique key "unique" all in all "newstitleunique".

﻿138. CSS Responsive embedable

It can be difficult to work with responsive iframes and other embedable stuff. Here is a little snippet which could possible help. .embed-wrapper {

position: relative;

display: block;

height: 0;

padding: 0;

overflow: hidden;
padding-bottom: 50%; // Adjust to you needs

} .embed {

position: absolute;

top: 0;

left: 0;

bottom: 0;

height: 100%;

width: 100%;

border: 0;

}

136. Optional Callback in JavaScript

Sometimes you need a callback to be optional. function crush(material, cb){ // Crush material console.log(material + " has been crushed"); // Callback if (cb && typeof(cb) === "function") { cb(); } } crush("stone"); crush("stone", function(){ console.log("Good job"); }); Link: http://codepen.io/johnbrowe/pen/oBbVwO?editors=1111
9:
135. Undefined offset: 0

Once in a while you get a exception like this one. ErrorException in Collection.php line 1187: Undefined offset: 0 (View: /home/vagrant/Code/.../resources/views/.../index.blade.php) And if this error occurs in Laravel you are quick to panic and run away to Google I know I do. But most likely this is an error that occurs when you are trying to access a key that does not exists in an array. Example: $list = ["Sara", "Tinna", "John"]; echo $list[0]; // "Sara" echo $list[2]; // "John" echo $list[3]; // Undefined offset: 3 :4 So just go through your view file at figure out where you are trying to access a key that does not exist.

130. Connecting to MongoDB Debian VM

Working on a new project I needed to connect to at MongoDB instance on a Debian virtual machine. I had many multiple problem firstly installing the right version of Mongo and futher more connecting to the MongoDB with Robomongo. I tried multiple different installs but nothing really worked. But I found a solution on SO where it said I should commment out bindip = 127.0.0.1 and so I did. Edit mongod.conf: sudo nano /etc/mongod.conf Comment out bindp:

bind_ip = 127.0.0.1

Restart MongoDB: sudo service mongod restart Here are some other usefull command for debugging MongoDB: ps -ef | grep mongo lsof -i -ac mongod sudo service mongod status sudo lsof -iTCP -sTCP:LISTEN | grep mongo

28:
118. All input not showing on submit

I got a bug on on of my web apps as newly created products where not being sent when I submitted the form. Every input looked good in the form and I just many many many hours trying to debug this issue. The problem was PHP has a default security setting that says PHP will not receive more than 1000 input fields. And i was sending about 1100 fields meaning that last 100 input fields would not show up. It just ignores the rest and will not send an error. If you are using the Apache the fix is simple just add these lines to you .htaccess file. phpvalue maxinputvars 6000 phpvalue suhosin.post.maxvars 6000 phpvalue suhosin.request.maxvars 6000 And you are good to go. On Nginx you need to edit the php.ini file, and uncomment the line with maxinputvars and set it to a higher number. If you are not sure where the php.ini is located just use the phpinfo(); function. There will be a row called "Loaded Configuration File" which will tell you the path to the php.ini file. The path will be something like this /etc/php/7.0/php.ini. So to edit you could use a line like as this. nano /etc/php/7.0/php.ini It will look like this: ; maxinputvars = 1000 I changed mine to this: maxinput_vars = 4000 After this you have to restart php process manager with this command: /etc/init.d/php7.0-fpm restart Now it should work

117. Install Node on Ubuntu

After installing apt-get install nodejs. I could only use node by using command nodejs, which does not work well with Gulp packages. After reading up on it it seems there is some kind of conflict package on apt-get therefore we need to remove the existing "node" app.

  • sudo apt-get --purge remove node Also remove nodejs so you can install it again.
  • sudo apt-get --purge remove nodejs Then you can install nodejs again and this time it will react on "node" command
  • sudo apt-get install nodejs ﻿

The main was i went directly to New Connection and pressed the SSH tab and filled in: Host name/IP Address: 127.0.0.1 Port: 2222 User Name: vagrant Authentication Method: Public Key Public key: (path to you private key) Passphrase: secret And i get this error: 1045 - Access denied for user root@localhost (using password: No) The problem was of course to fill out the general tab with this data: Connection name: (whatever you want) Host name/IP Address: localhost Port: 3306 User Name: homestead password: secret
33:
113. My first extension Chrome extension

I have always wondered how a Chrome extension works. Now I know. I needed to set a cookie with an ID onload every time the browser was updated locally to emulate a cloud service. I found out it is quite simple to setup. I created a folder called addcookie with two files: addcookie/ - content.js - manifest.js In manifest.js I inserted this code: // Manifest { "manifestversion": 2, "name": "Add Cookie Local", "version": "0.1", "contentscripts": [ { "matches": [ "" ], "js": ["content.js"] } ] } In content.js is just set the cookie: // content.js document.cookie = "Ely_vID=114p93086"; Upload the folder to chrome extension: settings => Extensions => Load unpacked extension

106. Set up xdebug with Homestead & PHPStorm

You need homestead box version 4.2.0 (versions before this do not have xdebug to php 7) First ssh in to your homestead box: vagrant up Vagrant SSH When you are ssh'd in type: (this will create a file called debug.ini, you can called it something else if you want) sudo nano /etc/php/7.0/fpm/conf.d/debug.ini add this snippet and save: xdebug.remoteenable = 1 xdebug.remotehost = 10.0.2.2 xdebug.remote_port = 9000 xdebug.idekey = phpstorm Add the right to the file: sudo chmod a+x debug.ini Install chrome extension: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/xdebug-helper/eadndfjplgieldjbigjakmdgkmoaaaoc Activate extention Right click on extension icon and choose options: set ide key dropdown to other and write phpstorm (in lowercase, should be same as xdebug.idekey) PHPSTORM Go to settings: file -> settings -> languages & frameworks -> PHP -> Servers Click:

  • (plus icon) Name: Homestead (can be what ever you want) Shared: uncheck Host: your-local-domain-name.app (in my case johnhoj.app) Port: 9000 (same as xdebug.remote_port) Debugger: Xdebug Use path mappings: check right to the path to your project directory: Double click (absolute path on the server) Write the same path as your homestead.yaml folder to path is: example: /home/vagrant/johnhoj
    Then click apply.

Here is my solution: Click start type regedit in search Click regedit.exe HKEYLOCALMACHINE\Software\Policies\Google Here you fill find a map called chrome, just delete it and restart Chrome. And you are good to go. https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/chrome/suI0cnVv7AM

Here is my solution: Click start type regedit in search Click regedit.exe HKEYLOCALMACHINE\Software\Policies\Google\Chrome In this map there is a file called DeveloperToolsDisabled Just delete it. Shut down Chrome, and then start it a again. Now Developer tools should work. 91. Copy files to Homestead via SSH

For some kind of reason I was not able to use sftp to login to my Homestead. I needed to upload some files locally to get my environment to behave as I wanted. So the so solution was to upload via SSH, which is beautiful. Upload/transfer folder: scp -P 2222 -r local/location vagrant@127.0.0.1:/remote/location Example: scp -P 2222 -r ~/downloads/fontsfolder vagrant@127.0.0.1:~/.fonts/ scp file.php user@remote.host:~/Code/app Here are some other examples. Link: http://www.shellhacks.com/en/10-Examples-Copying-Files-over-SSH
56:
90. Snappy Laravel 4.2 problem (wkhtmltopdf)

I had some problems with getting Snappy Laravel (wkhtmltopdf) to work in my homestead box. Here are the steps to get it working:

  1. sudo apt-get install wkhtmltopdf (this will be located at /usr/bin directory) # you can cd to the dir example: cd /usr/bin and see if they are installed there
  2. sudo chmod a+x /usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf
  3. sudo apt-get install openssl build-essential xorg libssl-dev
  4. sudo /usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf http://www.google.com test.pdf #Test if this works, in my machine it did not work and I had to do some more steps
  5. sudo apt-get install xvfb
  6. touch wkhtmltopdf.sh (this should be done in the /usr/bin/ folder)
  7. sudo nano wkhtmltopdf.sh
  8. add this line: xvfb-run wkhtmltopdf "$@"
  9. ctrl + o (to save)
  10. ctrl + x (to exit)
  11. wkhtmltopdf.sh http://www.google.com test.pdf (should create pdf file named test.pdf) # in my case I printed it out to /usr/test.pdf like this, because of permissions # wkhtmltopdf.sh http://www.google.com usr/test.pdf
  12. Now edit snappy config file mine is located in /app/config/packages/barryvdh/laravel-snappy/config.php # In some cases you will get permission denied
  13. If so you need to get the wkhtmltopdf.sh permission by writing: chmod +x filename.sh
    Config.php file should look like this: array( 'enabled' => true, 'binary' => '/usr/bin/wkhtmltopdf.sh', 'options' => array(), ), 'image' => array( 'enabled' => true, 'binary' => '/usr/bin/wkhtmltoimage.sh', 'options' => array(), ), ); If you don’t have a config read this documentation: https://github.com/barryvdh/laravel-snappy/tree/0.1 This link helped me on the right track. Link: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9604625/wkhtmltopdf-cannot-connect-to-x-server

83.Vue.js component inside component

File structure: /Vue/app.js /Vue/Components/parent.js /Vue/Components/child.js Here is app file: new Vue({ el: "#app", components: { 'parent-component': require('./components/admin/parent') } }); // Parent component file module.exports = { // This is the important part
components: { 'counter': require('./counter') }, ready: function(){} data: function () {}, methods: {} } // Child component module.exports = { template: '', data: function () { return { count: 0 } } methods: {} };

72. Vue.js passing args to the event function

HTML should look like this:

  • {{ $index }} - {{ parentMsg }} {{ item.childMsg }}

Javascript should look like this: var demo = new Vue({ el: '#demo', data: { parentMsg: 'Hello', items: [ { childMsg: 'Foo' }, { childMsg: 'Bar' }, { childMsg: 'bla' }, { childMsg: 'sma' } ] }, methods: { onClick: function (obj) { console.log(obj.childMsg); } } }) As you can see we pass the argument "onclick(item)" which is the same as the v-for item.

81:
65. Reset SSD Ubuntu 15.04

cd /dev/ sudo hdparm -I sda Then it will show some text, we are interested in this part, specically the part that says frozen: " Security: Master password revision code = 65534 supported not enabled (this should be enabled) not locked frozen (this should be not frozen) not expired: security count supported: enhanced erase 4min for SECURITY ERASE UNIT. 2min for ENHANCED SECURITY ERASE UNIT. " We want it to say not frozen and enabled To do this write: systemctl suspend The system will suspend and then start up again, when it does write "sudo hdparm -I sda" again. Now it will say: not frozen Now type to change enabled to not enabled: sudo hdparm --user-master u --security-set-pass A-pass-word sda Then the cli will display: securitypassword="A-pass-word" If you type sudo "hdparm -I sda" it should say: enabled (instead of not enabled) Final step, which will wipe the SSD which mean everything on the SSD will be lost, so backup if have something on that want. Now type: hdparm --user-master u --security-erase A-pass-word sda Links: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bMir8LOXX6U https://ata.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/ATASecure_Erase

83:
63. Could not ssh into server

I had forgotten all my credentials to a remote server, which I really wanted to log in to. It was a digitalocean server so I could just login to my account and reset the password. After this I tried to ssh in to the server in any possible way, but I just could not. When I wrote ssh root@ipaddress I got "permission denied". So I figured out problem which was that I tried to ssh in with root and by default login in with root is not permitted. To test if this was the case I accessed to web console droplet and wrote: nano /etc/ssh/sshdconfig So in this file I changed "PermitRootLogin no" to "PermitRootLogin yes" and then: sudo service ssh restart After this I had not problem loggin in. My guess is that there is a reason why root is not permitted login by default, so I changed it back "PermitRootLogin no" and figured out how to create another user. Link: http://askubuntu.com/questions/497895/permission-denied-for-rootlocalhost-for-ssh-connection

87:
59. Kill Node process

Usually when you want to quit a node server you press CTRL + C or CTRL + Z. But if you want to stop the Node server where you have killed of the terminal that you used to start Node. You get this error if you try to start node again: Error: listen EADDRINUSE :::3000 at Object.exports.errnoException (util.js:837:11) at exports.exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:860:20) at Server.listen2 (net.js:1231:14) at listen (net.js:1267:10) at Server.listen (net.js:1363:5) at EventEmitter.listen (/root/my-site/nodemodules/express/lib/application.js:617:24) at Object. (/root/my-site/index.js:33:5) at Module.compile (module.js:434:26) at Object.Module.extensions..js (module.js:452:10) at Module.load (module.js:355:32) You can fix this with: Write: ps aux | grep node Find the process ID, which second from the left (in my case 4 digits) it should look something like this: root xxxx 0.0 xx xxxxxx xxxxx pts/0 Sl+ 09:18 0:00 node index.js root xxxx 0.0 xx xxxxx xxx pts/4 S+ 09:41 0:00 grep --color=au Then write: kill -9 PROCESS_ID For example: kill -9 4485 and then you are good to go.

56. SSH - Host key verification failed.

I had just started a new droplet on Digitalocean with an SSH key, but I could not ssh. I keept getting this error.

  • Host key verification failed. This can often be caused of ssh know host, and often I just delete it. But in this case the problem was more embarrising. When the question - Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? was set I just pressed ENTER. This is not enough you must type: yes (enter)

46. A git to remember

Here is what you do Unchecked - Settings / Appearance & Behavior / System Settings / Save file on frame deactivation Unchecked - Settings / Appearance & Behavior / System Settings / Save files automatically if... Unchecked - Settings / Editor / General / Editor tabs / Mark modified tabs with asterisk This solution was found in stackoverflow on this link: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15604889/how-to-turn-off-automatic-saving-on-web-storm

43. MySQL Workbench login to homestead

Choose connection method: Standard TCP/IP over SSH Connection name: What Ever you want SSH Hostname: 127.0.0.1:2222 SSH Username: vagrant SSH Key File: if you don't have a key you need to create one with putty or through git bash MySQL hostname: 127.0.0.1 MySQL Server Port: 3306 Username: homestead password: secret
104:
42. Set path and enviroment variables Windows 7

Right-click the Computer icon and select Properties. Click the Advanced System Settings it on the left hand side. In the System Properties window, click on the Advanced tab, then click the Environment Variables. In the Environment Variables window highlight the Path variable in the "System variables" section and click the Edit button. Add or modify the path lines with the paths you want the computer to access. You can also set the path via the command prompt (search: cmd) For example I set my path when installing nodejs like this. If the path is: C:\Program Files\Nodejs do like this. This string will be set the enviroment variable til you close prompt: SET PATH=C:\Program Files\Nodejs;%PATH% This will set the variable for good: setx path "%path%;C:\Program Files\Nodejs" Links: http://www.computerhope.com/issues/ch000549.htm http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12155268/ruby-environment-variables

39. Z-index only working in Chrome bug

I had a cross browser bug which involved z-index only not working in Chrome, the solution was to change position to absolute instead of relative.

.element { position: relative; z-index: 1; } to .element { position: absolute; z-index: 1; }

111:
35. Vagrant Box stopped working

I got this error after updating homestead. My solution was to delete current version, installing it again. In my case when updating there where 2 box versions, I think this could have been the problem though im not sure. Open command line and write: vagrant box list to see what boxes you have. In my case this was the result: laravel/homestead (virtualbox, 0.2.5) laravel/homestead (virtualbox, 0.2.6) To delete them you write: vagrant box remove laravel/homestead --box-version 0.2.5 vagrant box remove laravel/homestead --box-version 0.2.6 After that cd to the homestead folder and write: vagrant add laravel/homestead

33. Javascript round up to nearest number

Here is how: 2 * Math.round(number / 2); Example 2 * Math.round(3 / 2); /* output 4 */ 2 * Math.round(8 / 2); /* output 8 */ 2 * Math.round(11 / 2); /* output 12 */

29. Debugging/Freezing Bootstrap tooltips & popover

It can be hard to style certain element because they disappear when you try to click on them. This is certainly the case with Bootstrap tooltips & popovers, when you try to inspect the element it will disappear. My solution is to this problem is to make them visible with JavaScript, here is how: $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip('show'); OR $('[data-toggle="popover"]').popover('show'); then through the developer tool navigate through the HTML to the popover element which in this case will not disappear.

20. Ubuntu switch keyboard language

In my Ubuntu 14.04 the text entry would not react or do anything, not sure why. It's a good thing we always can rely on the commandline, it's quite much faster as well. setxkbmap es or setxkbmap dk or setxkbmap fo To set it permanently you can do like this sudo nano /etc/default/keyboard This will appear:

XKBMODEL="pc105" XKBLAYOUT="us" XKBVARIANT="" XKBOPTIONS="" Then change XKBLAYOUT="**" to the prefered language in my case XKBLAYOUT="dk"
127:
19. Startcd PhpStorm-133.982/bin

./phpstorm.sh PHPstorm cli Ubuntu I had problems starting PHPstorm as Ubuntu newbie, but figured it out by cd'ing to the bin directory in the PHP installation and starting the program by using ./ then a launch icon will be added to the desktop launch bar. Now you just right click the the PHPstorm icon a press "lock to launcher" cd PhpStorm-133.982/bin ./phpstorm.sh if you want to start it from home, then: ./PhpStorm-133.982/bin/phpstorm.sh and to make an alias type this in the terminal; sudo nano ~/.bashrc Then usually i go to the bottom the file and write something like this:

CUSTOM ALIASES - JOHN

alias storm='./PhpStorm-139.1348/bin/phpstorm.sh' alias phpstorm='./PhpStorm-139.1348/bin/phpstorm.sh' Then save with: CTRL+O (then press enter) CTRL+X (to exit the document) Then you need to reopen the terminal or just open a new terminal to get it working.

13. Start node program without using the node command

This works for Ubuntu and other unix like systems. Create a javascript file called something.js Insert this code:

!/usr/bin/node --harmony

console.log("hello world"); Then go to terminal and cd to the file directory and write: ./something.js The output should be "hello world"

11. Close telnet connection in terminal

As i was Playing with Node and TCP i did not know how to disconnect from a connection in the terminal. With a little google help i figured out it was kind of easy. Press: CTRL + ] (I have a danish keyboard so in my case it is CTRL + Alt Gr + 9) then you should see something like this "telnet>" and then type quit Now the connection should be gone.

7. Cut(limit string length) string in PHP

140:
6. Accessing illegal name properties from PHP Objects

I quite a long time to figure this one out. I had a json decoded object where the object keys had some illegal characters "this-is-the-illegal-string". This mean that the usual way will not work. $array = ['hello' => 'John', 'hello-world' => 'John']; $objext = (object)$array; echo $object->['hello-world']; // This does not work The solution is to use curly braces echo $object->{'hello-world'}; // This works
141:
Express params

I just started using Express and had some problems on how to use params to display pages "blog" pages.

app.get('/notes/:note', function(req, res){
    var notes = require(__dirname + '/pages/content/notes.json');
    res.render(__dirname + '/pages/note', { note: note. [req.params.note]});    
});

You will notice that I use the :note after the path /notes/:note This will catch the unknown params that are added to the path. You can use this string/value with req.param.note Note can ofcourse be what ever you want forexample :bla then you would use req.param.bla to get the value.
142:
Relative CSS link

I typical mistake is to make CSS links relative by not using / at the start of the link.

<link href='css/main.css' rel='stylesheet' type='text/css'>

It should instead be:

<link href='/css/main.css' rel='stylesheet' type='text/css'>

Write more about this..........
143:
Wordpress WYSIWYG not showing

The WP WYSIWYG just disappeared out of no where for me. My fix was to go to Users -> Profile (f.eks. Admin) Check the Visual Editor checkbox then save and then uncheck checkbox and save This worked for me
